required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultralow Dose PAH Binary Mixture Study
clinical_study.official_title: Ultralow Dose PAH Binary Mixture Study

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the pharmacokinetics for [14C]-benzo[a]pyrene ([14C]-BaP) and metabolites in plasma and urine over 48 hours following a 50 ng dose (5.4 nCi) alone or with 1250 ng phenanthrene.

detailed_description.textblock: The pharmacokinetics for [14C]-BaP and metabolites will be assessed by UHLPC-Accelerator Mass Spectrometry (AMS, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory) in plasma and urine collected over 48 hours following oral doses of 50 ng dose (5.4 nCi) alone or with 1250 ng phenanthrene. Metabolite profiles and kinetics of elimination are predicted to be consistent with a BaP physiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) model developed by Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL). A non-smoker, not exposed occupationally, receives 270-700 ng of BaP daily; about 95% dietary. The WHO has set an estimated safe daily lifetime (70 year/70 Kg individual, cancer endpoint) exposure to BaP of 42-350 ng. This protocol represents de minimus risk.

study_design_info.masking_description: Deidentified samples will be analyzed by AMS at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory and the pharmacokinetics determine at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma and urine 14C-BaP and 14C-BaP metabolite levels after oral dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma and urine levels of 14C-BaP and 14C-BaP metabolites measured by accelerator mass spectrometry

secondary_outcome.description: Determination of highest concentration of 14C-BaP in plasma

secondary_outcome.measure: Time at highest plasma concentration of 14C-BaP Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of time at which plasma concentration of 14C-BaP is highest

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under plasma concentration of 14C-BaP versus time curve AUC
secondary_outcome.description: Integration of concentration of 14C-BaP in plasma over time
Determination of constants for rate of elimination of 14C-BaP from plasma

arm_group.description: Capsule containing 50 ng (5.4 nCi) [14C]-benzo[a]pyrene (BaP) and 1250 phenanthrene

intervention.description: Oral micro-dose of 50 ng (5.4 nCi) [14C]-benzo[a]pyrene plus 1250 ng phenanthrene
intervention.other_name: Binary mixture of carcinogenic PAH and non-carcinogenic PAH

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 21-65 (inclusive)
- If female, must be post-menopausal or have had surgical sterilization to eliminate any possibility for fetal exposure
- Willing to defer blood donation for one month before, throughout, and one month after completion of study activities
- Willing to avoid consuming cruciferous vegetables, I3C or DIM supplements, smoked or cured meat or cheeses, or charcoal-grilled meats for 2 weeks prior to and during each study cycle (gas grilled foods acceptable)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoker (tobacco or other substances) or use of smokeless tobacco in past 3 months or living with smoker
- Regular use of medications that affect gut motility or nutrient absorption (e.g. cholestyramine, sucralfate, orlistat, pro- or anti-motility agents)
- History of gastrointestinal surgery (e.g. bariatric surgery, cholecystectomy) or gastrointestinal disorder (Crohn's disease, celiac disease, IBS, or colitis)
- Current or history of kidney or liver disease
- Prior high-dose 14C exposure from medical tests. (micro-dose 14C exposure not exclusionary)
- Occupational PAH exposure (e.g. roofers, asphalt pavers, fire-fighters, etc.)
- Regular use of indole-3-carbinol or DIM dietary supplements

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified samples sent to Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory Deidentified data sent to Pacific Northwest National Laboratory
